author: CheckleyHappyH
title: Brilliant hotel in a great location
text:
We checked out this morning having spent 3 nights at the Nerva Boutique...when we come back to Rome we will stay here again.
From the moment we arrived service has been first class. We arrived at 1pm and our room was 10 mins from being ready. They offered us a seat in the bar and gave us complimentary drinks.
Reception staff happy to give you recommendations on places to visit (with a map) and places to eat. I have reviewed a number of restaurants separately.
The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Roman Forum and only about 10 minutes to the Colliseum. The area is very "historical" and a nice place to wander.
Taxis are very plentiful in Rome and reasonably priced (10 euros to Vatican). Tips are also not expected by taxi drivers.
Rooms in hotel are smart ours had a shower (with toiletries) and a very comfortable bed. The TV was cleverly disguised as a mirror (I heard other guests say they couldn't find the TV!)
Breakfast was not included but a good selection of continental breakfasts were available for 10 euros or less. The bar area was also very clean. the bar itself opens until 1pm. We had 2 drinks last night (G&T plus a disserano and coke at about midnight last night cost for both a reasonable 12 euros).
True the are livelier places in Rome to stay but for me Nerva was perfect at a reasonable cost (480 euros for 3 nights including discount for paying in cash).
Don't often give 5 stars for hotels but this rating is thoroughly deserved.
